intro: Burtonia asperula, commonly known as the rough burtonia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a rough, textured surface. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the rainy season. Burtonia asperula is often found in moist, shaded habitats within its native range.
